section.title: Connections View and Database Structure View
Connections View
section.para: Connections View enables users to create connection profile than can connect to specific database of DBMS and create and manage the connection. To create new connection profile, select "New Connection Profile..." through Context Menu at Connections View, and enter the information you need. Some users may be required to set JDBC driver("Preferences > SQL Explorer > JDBC Drivers")at Eclipse environment setting depending on their environment.

In addition, users can test Query through SQL Editor before setting actual Query in Query mapping xml file. SQL Editor opens automatically when database connection is created, and if SQL Editor is closed or if you want to open it additionally, select "New SQL Editor" on Context Menu for the connection.

note.title: Note : How to use connection way properly
note.para: For Query Manager to properly operate, you have to register only one Connection to use to Connection View.

section.title: Database Structure View
section.para: Database Structure View shows database structure of database connection user connected in tree format.

Anyframe Query Manager shows how to create Table Mapping information at Database Structure View and you can execute the function by selecting "Generate Table Mapping" on Context Menu after searching the table you want at Database Structure View.
